Interface RealBlackBoxProblem

public interface RealBlackBoxProblem

This interface gives the functionality of a real valued black box problem. It defines a real valued function over the real domain [0,1]^n().

Method Summary
 double eval(double[] solution)
          This gives the function value for the given double vector.
 double lower()
          This gives the best known lower bound of the function.
 int n()
          This gives the dimensionality of the real search domain.
 double upper()
          This gives the best known upper bound of the function.
 

Method Detail

n

public int n()
This gives the dimensionality of the real search domain.

lower

public double lower()
This gives the best known lower bound of the function. Might return Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY. In case of stochastic functions this should be understood as the lower bound of the expected value.

upper

public double upper()
This gives the best known upper bound of the function. Might return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY. In case of stochastic functions this should be understood as the upper bound of the expected value.

eval

public double eval(double[] solution)
This gives the function value for the given double vector. The length of solution must be n(), and the i-th element of the vector must be in the interval [0,1].
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the vector is null or its length is not n() or if one of the vector elements is outside [0,1].
